TopicTitle: Key bindings: multiple keys per function, multiple functions per key - possible?

Articles.Content:
The answer is probably 'no', but I\'m hoping there\'s a way to both assign multiple keys to the same function, and multiple functions per key. Specifically, I\'d love it if the rotation keys also acted as the SAS hold key, so I could turn SAS on and it would auto-disengage temporarily when I\'m giving rotation commands (equivalent to holding 'F' at the same time as rotation keys).

In the .cfg, I tried listing multiple keys, separated by commas, for the hold command, and I tried making multiple entries for the hold command. Neither succeeded.

So, is it possible? Or should I try something totally independent like AutoHotkey? =P

Well, the KSP settings screen (from memory) allows up to two keys per function. You can attempt to apply the F key to all rotational control AND the SAS toggle if you want, but I have no clue as to what sort of duplicate assignment checking KSP has.

Well, the KSP settings screen (from memory) allows up to two keys per function.

Ah, you\'re right. Well, then I guess my real question is, can more than 2 keys be assigned to the same function?

All you can do is try it from the settings screen

If it won\'t let you, apply two keys to one bind from within the game, open up the config to see how it records them, copy that and try binding more than one thing to the same key. See if it notices or works.
